page.title: 14The Severn Tunnel Band
page.content: This Brass Band was started fifty years ago by men working at the Severn Tunnel Junction. We rehearse at Green Lane Junior School and at "The Haywain". The uniform which we wear for concerts and competitions consists of black trousers or skirts and specially made jumpers and blazers. Many of the young members of our band were taught to play by our conductor, Mr. Ron Cummings. We enter many competitions at places such as Crosskeys, Swansea, Treorchy and Stroud. In October 1984 we entered a competition at the Royal Albert Hall. We didn't win because the standard was very high but we all enjoyed playing in such a magnificent Hall.
